Hi,

I found this blog very helpful:
http://www.dreamersrealm.net/~tree/blo=
g/?s=3Dtext%2Fhtml&submit=3DGO, when
trying to implemnt a job which would i=
gnore sending requests for uri's
ending with certain file formats and also =
to look at response header
for content-type and decide whether to fetch the=
 body or not.

Manav

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Artem Antono=
v"
<antonov.artem@...> wrote:
>
> Hello,      
>          
> I use Heritrix=
 1.10.1.         
> How I can set the regular expression to specify which f=
ile types to
        
> fetch (for example, only "txt" and "html" files)?  =
    
>         
> The questions are:      
>       
> 1) In which section I=
 should define a RegExp:        
> - tab "Submodules" in Web console -> "pr=
e-fetch-processors" section
       
> -> Preselector -> <myFilter>, OR     =
   
> - tab "Submodules" in Web console -> "fetch-processors" section -> 
 =
     
> HTML -> <myFilter> ?        
>         
> 2) All of types org.archi=
ve.crawler.filter.* are Deprecated, so I  
     
> should use org.archive.c=
rawler.deciderules.DecidingFilter type, and
       
> define my decide-rule=
s (for example,        
> org.archive.crawler.deciderules.MatchesRegExpDeci=
deRule)? 
>       
> 3) There is a section in order.xml file:     
>      
=
> <newObject name=3D"Preselector"    
> class=3D"org.archive.crawler.prefet=
ch.Preselector">     
>  <boolean name=3D"enabled">true</boolean>     
>  <=
map name=3D"filters">     
>  </map>     
>  <boolean name=3D"override-logg=
er">false</boolean>     
>  <boolean name=3D"recheck-scope">true</boolean> =
    
>  <boolean name=3D"block-all">false</boolean>     
>  <string name=3D=
"block-by-regexp"></string>     
>  <string name=3D"allow-by-regexp"></stri=
ng>     
> </newObject>     
>     
> So, what do mean these lines:    
>  =
<string name=3D"block-by-regexp"></string>     
>  <string name=3D"allow-by=
-regexp"></string>     
>     
> Can I define here a RegExp to restrict fil=
es types to fetch?  
>   
> Thanks in advance.      
>       
> Regards,   =
   
> Artem Antonov.
>
